properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 6 at 3:30AM AKST until February 6 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility occuring, along
with very cold wind chills. Plan on difficult travel conditions.
Wind chills to 55 below. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2
inches from the Dalton Highway west.

* WHERE...Southeastern Brooks Range from the Dalton Highway West.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM today.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The windiest conditions, along with the
lowest visibility and coldest wind chills will be in passes.
Wind chills to 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little
as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Motorists should be prepared
for drifting snow on the highway, and very cold wind chills.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be
obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING
